A business requirement is supplied to an architect from a car manufacturer stating their business model is changing to just-in-time manufacturing and a new network is required, the manufacturer does not produce all of the specific components in-house, which area should the architect focus on initially?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The architect should initially focus on A. Modularity.

Selected Answer: D
I think ans is D

In just-in-time manufacturing, fast data transmission and low latency are critical. This is because the supply chain and manufacturing processes are time sensitive, and delays can have a direct impact on business efficiency. Low latency infrastructure enables real-time information exchange and is a key component of successful just-in-time manufacturing.

Selected Answer: A
In a just-in-time (JIT) manufacturing model, the focus is on optimizing supply chain efficiency and ensuring components are available precisely when needed. Given that the car manufacturer does not produce all components in-house, the architect should prioritize a modular network design that can seamlessly integrate with external suppliers, partners, and production systems. Modularity ensures the network can adapt to the dynamic needs of the JIT model, such as connecting new suppliers or handling varying workloads.
